utils

Class MathUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • utils.MathUtils

  • public final class MathUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility class containing everything math related
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    EPICI

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static double D_EPSILON
      Default epsilon value used for doubles
      Double has 53 mantissa bits, 2^-53 is around 1.1x10^-16, so 10^-12 is a safe value to use
      static double F_EPSILON
      Default epsilon value used for floats
      Float has 24 mantissa bits, 2^-24 is around 6.0x10^-8, so 10^-6 is a safe value to use

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static double bezier(double[] ds, double t)
      Bezier with more points
      Very inefficient, uses naive recursive approach
      TODO please someone replace with De Casteljau's
      static double bezier(double t, double... ds)
      Bezier with more points
      Redirects to the one that takes an array
      static double bezier2(double a, double b, double t)
      Standard 2 point bezier
      Wikipedia
      static double bezier2to4(double a, double b, double t)
      Fast bezier4 for (a,a,b,b)
      Polynomial expanded and refactored to do far less work
      static boolean isNear(double a, double b)
      Checks if two values are absolutely near, uses default double epsilon value
      Use this instead of equality check
      static boolean isNear(double a, double b, double epsilon)
      Checks if two values are absolutely near, uses given epsilon value
      Use this instead of equality check

      Checks if two values are absolutely near, uses default float epsilon value
      Use this instead of equality check

      Checks if two values are absolutely near, uses given epsilon value

      • D_EPSILON

        public static final double D_EPSILON
        Default epsilon value used for doubles
        Double has 53 mantissa bits, 2^-53 is around 1.1x10^-16, so 10^-12 is a safe value to use
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • F_EPSILON

        public static final double F_EPSILON
        Default epsilon value used for floats
        Float has 24 mantissa bits, 2^-24 is around 6.0x10^-8, so 10^-6 is a safe value to use
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

        public static double bezier2(double a,
                             double b,
                             double t)
        Standard 2 point bezier
        Wikipedia
        Parameters:
        a - the first value to interpolate between
        b - the second value to interpolate between
        t - interpolation value, must be between 0 and 1
        Returns:
        the interpolated value

      • bezier2to4

        public static double bezier2to4(double a,
                                double b,
                                double t)
        Fast bezier4 for (a,a,b,b)
        Polynomial expanded and refactored to do far less work
        Parameters:
        a - the first point to interpolate between
        b - the second point to interpolate between
        t - the interpolation value, must be between 0 and 1
        Returns:
        the interpolated value

      • isNear

        public static boolean isNear(double a,
                             double b)
        Checks if two values are absolutely near, uses default double epsilon value
        Use this instead of equality check
        Parameters:
        a - the first value
        b - the second value
        Returns:
        true if the two values are close

      • isNear

        public static boolean isNear(double a,
                             double b,
                             double epsilon)
        Checks if two values are absolutely near, uses given epsilon value
        Use this instead of equality check
        Parameters:
        a - the first value
        b - the second value
        epsilon - custom epsilon value
        Returns:
        true if |a-b|<epsilon
